chargeHist.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Connie L Smiley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Reduced In Value By More Than $2,500), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Arson of Building, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 payable to Larry K.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
The Court orderd that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA surcharge and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Seek and maintain full time employment and/or school.

Continue prescribed medications.
Referral to the Benedict Center.
Mental health  assessment, AODA assessment and other counseling needs to be determined.
On June 2, 2022:  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.  Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Connie L Smiley

records.addlTxt: Per clerical error.

Defendant Connie L Smiley in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Connie L Smiley in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Sentencing Hearing. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 24 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 147 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 9 MONTHS.  

AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 147 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.  CONCURRENT WITH COUNT 1. 

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AS TO COUNT 2: Serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction STAYED pending agents review. Release to the Day Reporting Center.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
Mental Health Assessment, AODA Assessment and other counseling needs to be determined.
Continue perscribed medications. 
Referral to the Benedict Center.
Seek and maintain full-time employment and/or school.
No contact with Chrysse B.
Restitution in the amount of $1,000.00 payable to Larry K. 

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.
filed.
Victim Impact Statement; filed.
Invoice dated 5/26/2022 sent to Accts Payable Dept on 6/9/22 in the amount of $1,187.50 to Dr. Matthew Seipel, Ph. D. for services on 4/27/22, 5/6/22, 5/8/22.

Defendant Connie L Smiley in court with attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Connie L Smiley in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, branch 38. Court vacated trial date for 6-13-2022.

FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.
filed.

Defendant Connie L Smiley in court, via zoom, with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Connie L Smiley in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties are in receipt of Dr. Seipel's report and do not contest the findings. Court adopts the findings as the special plea is not supported. Defense requested a plea date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.
filed.
Letter from Dr. Seipel; filed.
Order for Examination under 971.16; filed.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Connie L Smiley not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Doctor's Report Return. A report has not been filed. Case remains set for Final Pretrial on May 19, 2022 at 8:15 am, Branch 38.
Court is advised by the defense that they are requesting a NGI Evalution.  Court ordered defendant examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Connie L Smiley not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by Defense argued and DENIED by the Court.   All conditions remain the same.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Connie L Smiley in court with Attorney Katherine Graber.  Defendant Connie L Smiley in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Connie L Smiley not in court, defendant in custody. Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CLB.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Connie L Smiley in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Connie L Smiley in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Connie L Smiley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
